attributes.action: Demand that David Cameron sticks to his promise regarding the EU deal
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Cameron has clearly broken the promise that he made to the British people.
Mr Cameron stated that if he did not get the deal that he wanted from the EU then he would encourage a vote out of the EU.
Mr Cameron has covered this up big style by printing leaflets to stay in the EU before any deal had been made.
He has claimed victory with a package that is far from what he promised his people.
Mr Cameron should be forced to keep his promise and vote out of the EU.
attributes.background:
Mr Cameron stated, if he didn't get the EU deal that he wanted then he would vote the U.K.  out of the EU. There needs to be a law in place That prevents any prime minister going back on a promise made to the public.
Mr Cameron has not getting the deal that he promised to this nation.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition in its current form as it does not call clearly for a specific action from the UK Government or Parliament.
